skill.name: laravel-specialist
skill.description: Use when building Laravel 10+ applications requiring Eloquent ORM, API resources, or queue systems. Invoke for Laravel models, Livewire components, Sanctum authentication, Horizon queues.
skill.summary: Expert Laravel 10+ development skill for building applications with Eloquent ORM, RESTful APIs, queue systems, and Livewire components.
skill.author: jeffallan

security_audit.summary: Security audit complete. All 193 static findings are false positives caused by the analyzer misinterpreting PHP and Laravel code patterns. The skill contains legitimate Laravel documentation with no malicious content or security risks.

dangerous_patterns.title: Ruby/Shell Backtick Execution - False Positive
dangerous_patterns.description: Static scanner incorrectly detects '$this' in PHP code as shell backtick execution. In PHP, $this is a reserved variable referring to the current object instance, not shell execution.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: PHP code examples using standard $this object reference are misidentified as shell backticks - clear false positive

dangerous_patterns.title: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm - False Positive
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner incorrectly flags Laravel methods like 'hasOne()' as weak cryptography. This is a standard Laravel Eloquent relationship method, not a cryptographic function.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Laravel Eloquent method names contain 'hash' substring but are not cryptographic functions - clear false positive

dangerous_patterns.title: System Reconnaissance - False Positive
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner incorrectly flags Laravel's now() helper function as system reconnaissance. now() is a standard Laravel helper that returns the current timestamp.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: now() is a standard Laravel date helper function, not system scanning - clear false positive

dangerous_patterns.title: AWS Credential Environment Variables - False Positive
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner flags env('AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID') as credential access, but this is standard Laravel configuration practice. env() reads from .env files which are not committed to version control.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Standard Laravel configuration pattern for reading environment variables from .env files - not actual credential exposure

dangerous_patterns.title: Hardcoded URL - False Positive
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner flags author URL in metadata as hardcoded URL. https://github.com/Jeffallan is a legitimate author reference.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Author GitHub URL and example URLs in documentation are legitimate - no security risk

dangerous_patterns.title: With Statement (Deprecated) - False Positive
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner incorrectly flags Laravel's with() Eloquent method as deprecated Python with statement. Laravel's with() is for eager loading relationships.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Laravel Eloquent with() method for eager loading is standard functionality - not Python deprecated statement

content.value_statement: Get expert Laravel 10+ development assistance for building robust applications with Eloquent ORM, RESTful APIs, and queue systems. The skill provides code examples, best practices, and implementation guidance for modern PHP development.
actual_capabilities: Create Eloquent models with relationships, scopes, and custom casts
Build RESTful APIs using Laravel API resources and controllers
Implement queue systems with jobs, batching, and failed job handling
Develop reactive interfaces with Livewire components and actions
Write comprehensive tests using Pest PHP and feature tests
Set up authentication with Laravel Sanctum and user management
limitations: Does not generate complete application boilerplates from scratch
Cannot access external Laravel packages or composer repositories
Does not execute code or interact with live databases
Cannot debug runtime errors or profile application performance

use_cases.title: Rapid API Development
use_cases.description: Build RESTful APIs faster with proper resource transformations, validation, and authentication using Laravel Sanctum.

use_cases.title: Database Model Design
use_cases.description: Design efficient Eloquent models with relationships, scopes, and query optimization to prevent N+1 queries.
use_cases.target_user: Full-stack developers working with Laravel databases

use_cases.title: Real-time Features
use_cases.description: Implement reactive user interfaces with Livewire for dynamic, real-time web applications without JavaScript.
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers adding interactivity to Laravel apps

prompt_templates.title: Create Eloquent Model
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Laravel Eloquent model for [MODEL_NAME] with relationships to User. Include fillable fields, date casts, and a scope for filtering active records.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building a new model with relationships and scopes

prompt_templates.title: Build REST API Endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Laravel API resource and controller for the Post model. Include index, show, store, update, and destroy methods with proper validation.

prompt_templates.title: Implement Queue Job
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Laravel queued job that processes user subscriptions. Include proper retry logic, unique job IDs, and failed job handling.

prompt_templates.title: Build Livewire Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Livewire component for a contact form with validation, wire:model binding, and a success message after submission.

output_examples.input: Create an Eloquent model for Order with relationships to User and OrderItem
output: Scope methods for filtering orders by status

output_examples.input: Set up a Laravel queue job for sending welcome emails
output: Email sending logic in handle() method

best_practices: Use Eloquent relationships and eager loading (with()) to prevent N+1 query problems
Always type-hint dependencies and use service containers for testability
Keep jobs small and focused with single responsibility for better maintainability
anti_patterns: Do not store sensitive data unencrypted - use Laravel encryption features
Do not skip eager loading which causes N+1 database queries
Do not put business logic in controllers - use service classes instead

faq.question: What Laravel versions does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on Laravel 10+ with PHP 8.2+ features. It covers modern Laravel patterns and practices.

faq.question: Can this skill help with Livewire development?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill includes comprehensive Livewire guidance for building reactive components with wire:model, actions, and lifecycle hooks.

faq.question: Does the skill cover testing?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes testing guidance using Pest PHP and PHPUnit, covering feature tests, factories, and mocking.

faq.question: Can this skill create complete applications?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides code examples and guidance for specific Laravel features. It does not generate full application boilerplates.

faq.question: Does the skill support queue systems?
faq.answer: Yes, it covers Laravel queues, job classes, batching, failed job handling, and Horizon configuration.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill is compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for AI-assisted Laravel development.
